name.namePart: Arthur and Elizabeth Schlesinger Library on the History of Women in America

physicalDescription.extent: 2.7 ft. (2 boxes) : ill. ; 28 x 33 x 41 cm. + 1 guide (152 p. ; 28 cm.)

mods.note: Typescripts, located in Schlesinger Library, Radcliffe College.

Autobiographical memoirs of a group of black American women 70 years of age and older, providing a body of resource material on the lives and contributions of black women in the twentieth century, especially in the years prior to the Civil Rights Movement. Interviewees have been active in fields as education, government, the arts, business, medicine, and law.
Photocopies of typescripts. Cambridge, Mass. : Radcliffe College, 1982. 29 cm. + contents list (7 leaves)
